image.altText: A large number of police line up across the street behind an orange barricade at the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre.

props.synopsis: Protesters have gathered outside the Melbourne venue where a major defence and weapons exhibition is being held. The deployment of extra police at the event is costing the government millions of dollars.

title.children: Protesters gather from the early hours to disrupt Land Forces defence expo in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: A composite images shows "Wanted" posters with the faces of Pyne and Machlis.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of military companies are displaying lethal defence technology at the Land Forces conference in Melbourne this week.

title.children: Protesters urging citizen's arrests for Christopher Pyne and CEOs at defence conference

image.altText: Genetic Testing

props.synopsis: Life insurers and those offering income protection and permanent disability insurance will be banned from using genetic testing to refuse cover after a government crackdown.

title.children: Genetic testing to be banned from life insurance, income protection, disability cover

image.altText: A white box of illegal Manchester cigarettes in a black bag.

props.synopsis: For the past decade, plain-packaging laws and steep tax increases have helped to reduce the national smoking rate, but a booming black market has led some to question whether the federal government's policy is still working.

title.children: Tobacco retail sales plummeting but not because people have quit smoking

image.altText: Two young boys and a woman pose in an front of a tree with yellow leaves. The faces of the boys and the woman are blurred.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the two children, aged nine and 11, were found dead west of Sydney.Â

title.children: 'As tragic as it gets': Two boys found dead, mother arrested in Blue Mountains

image.altText: A composite image of Emma Germano and a man in a suit pouring chemical.

props.synopsis: This farmer chose to speak up as peak lobby group closes ranks in the wake of investigations exposing Parkinson's link to chemical.

title.children: Australiaâs peak farm lobby tries to silence members after ABC investigation exposes Parkinsonâs link to controversial chemical

image.altText: Three gold medals and one silver from the silver olympics with colourful ribbons lie on a white table.

props.synopsis: Three gold medals and a silver, including one from the 2000 Sydney Olympics, were taken during a car break-in in Docklands.

title.children: Four Olympic medals belonging to member of Oarsome Foursome stolen in Melbourne

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The judge chairing an inquiry into an English hospital in which infant serial killer Lucy Letby worked tells a hearing anyone doubting the former nurse's guilt is causing her victims' families "enormous additional distress".

title.children: Lucy Letby was convicted of killing seven British babies. A judge has a warning for those who think she's innocent

image.altText: A father playing trains with his son.

props.synopsis: A specialised Victorian day care says it will end specialised classes for children with autism next year due to changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: This program provides specialist day care for children with autism, but it won't be around next year

image.altText: Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, wave farewell before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: The king and queen will tour Canberra and Sydney as part of a whirlwind trip next month, which will be the first visit of a reigning monarch to Australia in more than a decade.Â

title.children: BBQs, garden tours, and a parliamentary meet and greet â details of Charles and Camilla's royal visit next month revealed

image.altText: A busy pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Spencer and Collins streets in Melbourne's CBD.

props.synopsis: With Australia's economy growing at its slowest pace in decades and expectations interest rates could soon start to fall, analysts are warning there is too much "exuberance" on the share market.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank's share price continues to defy analyst expectations. Here's why

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor's prediction that she would hold interest rates for six months was the unlikely trigger for a political war over her institution.

title.children: Bullock's Lowe moment has put an end to the uneasy political truce over the RBA

image.altText: Raw vanadium rock

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Resources Minister Madeleine King will make duelling pitches to the Minerals Council of Australia, with the opposition leader promising to "turbocharge" mining and energy projects and overturn or restrict environmental decisions.

title.children: I'll be the best friend you ever had, Peter Dutton promises miners

image.altText: Oakley uses an asthma puffer

props.synopsis: New data has identified hundreds of asthma "hotspots" around the country â most of them in regional Australia.

title.children: Hundreds of asthma 'hotspots' discovered across Australia

image.altText: Halocell's 5-volt perovskite solar strip

props.synopsis: A start-up in regional NSW will be the first Australian company to produce at scale a new type of solar cell that works under artificial light to power devices like keyboards and headphones.

title.children: It's cheap, flexible and works indoors. Could this new solar cell replace batteries?

image.altText: A southern rock lobster

props.synopsis: Rock lobster fishers are growing increasingly frustrated about continuing Chinese government trade restrictions, months after the federal government declared they were on the brink of being lifted.

title.children: 'Baffling': Rock lobster industry struggles through fourth year of China ban

image.altText: Collage of photos Muriel McKay, the kidnapper (above) and (right) Anna and Rupert Murdoch, 1970

props.synopsis: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch loaned his Rolls Royce to his deputy. It led to a terrible case of mistaken identity that would change the course of two family's lives.

title.children: 18 months before Lachlan Murdoch was born his mother dodged a dark fate

image.altText: People stand around the edge of a deep crater in the sand

props.synopsis: At least 19 people have been killed in the camp in Khan Younis, in the designated humanitarian "safe zone" of Gaza where Israel's military had told hundreds of thousands of Palestinians to shelter.

title.children: 'Entire families disappeared under the sand' as Israeli strikes hit Gazan tent camp

image.altText: A boy on a surfboard paddling in the water.

props.synopsis: Locals who saw the door from a small plane plummet towards a Far South Coast beach, landing just metres from a fisherman, say it was "a crazy situation to witness".

title.children: Surfers stunned as plane door falls from sky and narrowly misses fisher on NSW beach

image.altText: An illustration showing a high school girl sitting in class with two boys ridiculing her behind her.

props.synopsis: Image-based abuse is a growing problem among Australian teenagers, but experts and victims say the support on offer for young people needs to be improved.

title.children: Anna's ex sent her nudes to his friends. They were soon circulating around multiple schools

image.altText: A wom and man in formal clothes and sunglasses walking

props.synopsis: Families have told a sentencing hearing for a bus driver who caused a fatal crash in the NSW Hunter Valley that their lives have been "shattered".Â

title.children: Hunter crash survivor details 'overwhelming sensation I was going to die' in emotional hearing

image.altText: Colourful graphic of a teenage girl sleeping with her head resting on a pile of books behind a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most Australian high schools start the day by 9am but a sleep researcher says pushing the morning bell back later could have some major benefits for teenagers' health.Â

title.children: Schools encouraged to start later to help 'chronically tired' teens

image.altText: Apollo Quiboloy speaks behind a desk with his right hand in the air during a press conference

props.synopsis: The rise of Apollo Quiboloy saw him attract millions of followers around the world, become a political king-maker and have connections to the highest office in the Philippines. Now, he's been arrested.

title.children: How a popular Philippine preacher landed on the FBIâs most-wanted list

image.altText: A bright orange globe and streak of light show where a drone was shot down over a city at night.

props.synopsis: NATO countries are becoming increasingly vocal about their capabilities to shoot down Russia drones and missiles, as Romania and Latvia become the latest members of the Western alliance to report Moscow violated their airspace.Â

title.children: Russian drones are entering NATO airspace, and some members say it's their 'duty' to respond

image.altText: Jacob Hersant, wearing a blue suit jacket and white shirt, walks beside a woman in a striped shirt.

props.synopsis: Jacob Hersant is accused of performing a Nazi salute in October last year, just days after the Victorian government banned the gesture.

title.children: First-ever Victorian charged over making Nazi salute launches legal defence in court

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has raised fresh concerns about proposed widespread reform to the aged care sector, leaving the immediate future of the promised new Aged Care Act up in the air.

title.children: Coalition flags unnamed concerns about aged care reforms, leaving sector in limbo

image.altText: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris speaking into microphones in two separate images side by side.

props.synopsis: Any doubts about whether a debate could change the course of a presidential campaign have been put to rest. So both Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are awake to the high stakes of today's face-off.

title.children: How to watch the presidential debate between Harris and Trump in Australia

image.altText: Picture of a smartphone screen with apps including facebook, instagram and youtube

props.synopsis: A social media ban that could capture the most popular video sites for children, gaming platforms and more is now on the table, with a bipartisan promise to remove the "scourge" from children's lives. Here's what we know about where the federal government is heading.

title.children: YouTube, TikTok and Meta are all in the firing line for children to be banned from their platforms. Here's what we know

image.altText: The Princess of Wales and her family sit smiling at the camera in a rural setting with green trees in the background

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales confirms she is no longer receiving chemotherapy, and says she will return to a light program of external engagements in the coming months.

title.children: Princess of Wales no longer receiving chemotherapy and 'doing what I can to stay cancer free'

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian emergency department has hired additional security guards as sicker patients and longer wait times lead to a rise in aggressive behaviour.

title.children: Health workers 'scared' for safety as agitated patients lash out

image.altText: The sea of yellow 'pope' umbrellas

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands flock to Timor-Leste's capital to welcome Pope Francis as he holds a mass in the world's most Catholic nation outside of the Vatican.

title.children: Thousands gather under sea of 'pope umbrellas' as pontiff performs mass in Dili

image.altText: Thmib1

props.synopsis: The Miami Dolphins have hit out at police after footage of star NFL wide receiver Tyreek Hill being arrested appeared to show excessive force being used.

title.children: Body camera footage shows arrest of NFL star Tyreek Hill as police criticised for using excessive force

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses and camouflage jacket walks down the stairs

props.synopsis: Four years after charges were dropped against the heir to the Red Bull empire over an alleged hit-and-run, eight people are under scrutiny, accused of helping him avoid court.

title.children: The Red Bull heir was accused of killing a cop. Now eight people who allegedly got him off the hook are on trial

image.altText: Darth Vader, Lando and Boba Fett having a conversation.

props.synopsis: The veteran actor died at 93 but his legacy lives on in the iconic characters that he brought to life with his trademark voice and on-screen presence.

title.children: From Mufasa to Darth Vader, here are some of James Earl Jones's most iconic characters
